forecaster.canada.accounts module¶

A module for Canada-specific ledger subclasses.

class forecaster.canada.accounts.PrincipleResidence(owner, balance=0, rate=0, transactions=None, nper=1, inputs=None, initial_year=None)[source]¶

Bases: forecaster.accounts.Account

A Canadian principle residence. Gains in value are not taxable.

class forecaster.canada.accounts.RRSP(owner, balance=0, rate=0, transactions=None, nper=1, inputs=None, initial_year=None, contribution_room=None, contributor=None, inflation_adjust=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: forecaster.accounts.RegisteredAccount

A Registered Retirement Savings Plan (Canada).

__init__(owner, balance=0, rate=0, transactions=None, nper=1, inputs=None, initial_year=None, contribution_room=None, contributor=None, inflation_adjust=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Initializes an RRSP object.

See documentation for Account and RegisteredAccount for information on any args not listed below.

Parameters:inflation_adjust –

A method with the following form: inflation_adjust(val, this_year, target_year).

Returns a Decimal object which is the inflation- adjustment factor from base_year to target_year.

Optional. If not provided, all values are assumed to be in real terms, so no inflation adjustment is performed.
balance_history¶

Record of balance over all past years.

Converts the RRSP to an RRIF.

min_outflow(when='end')[source]¶

Minimum RRSP withdrawal

next_contribution_room()[source]¶

Determines the amount of contribution room for next year.

Parameters:
  • income (Money) – The amount of taxable income for this year used to calculate RRSP contribution room.
  • year (int) – The year in which the income is received.
Returns:

The contribution room for the RRSP for the year after year.

class forecaster.canada.accounts.TaxableAccount(owner, balance=0, rate=0, transactions=None, nper=1, inputs=None, initial_year=None, acb=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: forecaster.accounts.Account

A taxable account, non-registered account.

This account uses Canadian rules for determining taxable income from capital assets. That involves tracking the adjusted cost base (acb) of the assets.

See Account for other attributes not listed below.

acb¶

Money – The adjusted cost base of the assets in the account at the start of the year.

capital_gain¶

Money – The total capital gains for the year. This is evaluated lazily, so it may return different values if you add or remove transactions.

__init__(owner, balance=0, rate=0, transactions=None, nper=1, inputs=None, initial_year=None, acb=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Constructor for TaxableAccount.

See documentation for Account for information on args not listed below.

Parameters:acb (Money) – The adjusted cost base of the assets in the account at the start of initial_year.
acb
